title: Gamification-Based Language Learning Motivation Enhancement Program: Integrated Reading-Writing Activity Design (Large-Scale)

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational language education theories (grammar, vocabulary, text analysis) and digital tool operation skills
context.additional_context: A course applying game-based motivational techniques in language education for practicing elementary educators, providing a blended learning environment combining digital devices with offline activities (role-playing, group discussions), focusing on enhancing learners' expressive skills and communication competencies.

learning_goals: Learners can propose language education design plans incorporating game elements (challenge, curiosity, control, fantasy) with â‰¥80% accuracy, including vocabulary expansion and grammar structure reinforcement.
Learners analyze intrinsic motivation factors (Challenge, Curiosity, Control, Fantasy) in educational game design and apply them to language learning models (listening, speaking, reading, writing).
Learners can design three or more language learning activities (writing, reading comprehension, pronunciation training) using gamification tools and measure motivational effects.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
